loading-error.name: Loading Error
loading-error.message: The data source could not be successfully loaded: {details}
loading-error.description: Data reading error because of IO error.

source-error.name: Source Error
source-error.message: The data source has not supported or has inconsistent contents: {details}
source-error.description: Data reading error because of not supported or inconsistent contents.

scheme-error.name: Scheme Error
scheme-error.message: The data source is in an unknown scheme: {details}
scheme-error.description: Data reading error because of incorrect scheme.

format-error.name: Format Error
format-error.message: The data source is in an unknown format: {details}
format-error.description: Data reading error because of incorrect format.

encoding-error.name: Encoding Error
encoding-error.message: The data source could not be successfully decoded: {details}
encoding-error.description: Data reading error because of an encoding problem.

schema-error.name: Schema Error
schema-error.message: Table Schema could not be used as it is invalid: {details}

blank-header.name: Blank Header
blank-header.message: Header in field number {fieldNumber} is blank
blank-header.description: A column in the header row is missing a value. Column names should be provided.

duplicate-header.name: Duplicate Header
duplicate-header.message: Header {header} in field number {fieldNumber} is duplicated to header in fields: {details}
duplicate-header.description: Two columns in the header row have the same value. Column names should be unique.

extra-header.name: Extra Header
extra-header.message: There is an extra header in field {fieldName}[{fieldNumber}]
extra-header.description: The first row of the data source contains header that doesn't exist in the schema.

missing-header.name: Missing Header
missing-header.message: There is a missing header in field {fieldName}[{fieldNumber}]
missing-header.description: Based on the schema there should be a header that is missing in the first row of the data source.

non-matching-header.name: Non-Matching Header
non-matching-header.message: Header {header} in field {fieldName}[{fieldNumber}] doesn't match the field name in the schema
non-matching-header.description: One of the data source headers doesn't match the field name defined in the schema.

blank-row.name: Blank Row
blank-row.description: This row is empty. A row should contain at least one value.

extra-value.name: Extra Value
extra-value.message: Row {rowNumber} has an extra value in field number {fieldNumber}
extra-value.description: This row has more values compared to the header row (the first row in the data source). A key concept is that all the rows in tabular data must have the same number of columns.

missing-value.name: Missing Value
missing-value.message: Row {rowNumber} has a missing value in field {fieldName}[{fieldNumber}]
missing-value.description: This row has less values compared to the header row (the first row in the data source). A key concept is that all the rows in tabular data must have the same number of columns.

type-error.name: Type Error
type-error.message: The value {cell} in row {rowNumber} and field {fieldName}[{fieldNumber}] is not type {fieldType} and format {fieldFormat}
type-error.description: The value does not match the schema type and format for this field.

required-constraint.name: Required Constraint
required-constraint.message: Field {fieldName}[{fieldNumber}] is a required field, but row {rowNumber} has no value
required-constraint.description: This field is a required field, but it contains no value.

unique-constraint.name: Unique Constraint
unique-constraint.message: Rows {rowNumber} has unique constraint violation in field {fieldName}[{fieldNumber}]
unique-constraint.description: This field is a unique field but it contains a value that has been used in another row.

pattern-constraint.name: Pattern Constraint
pattern-constraint.message: The value {cell} in row {rowNumber} and field {fieldName}[{fieldNumber}] does not conform to the pattern constraint of {constraint}
pattern-constraint.description: This field value should conform to constraint pattern.

enumerable-constraint.name: Enumerable Constraint
enumerable-constraint.message: The value {cell} in row {rowNumber} and field {fieldName}[{fieldNumber}] does not conform to the given enumeration: {constraint}
enumerable-constraint.description: This field value should be equal to one of the values in the enumeration constraint.

minimum-constraint.name: Minimum Constraint
minimum-constraint.message: The value {cell} in row {rowNumber} and field {fieldName}[{fieldNumber}] does not conform to the minimum constraint of {constraint}
minimum-constraint.description: This field value should be greater or equal than constraint value.

maximum-constraint.name: Maximum Constraint
maximum-constraint.message: The value {cell} in row {rowNumber} and field {fieldName}[{fieldNumber}] does not conform to the maximum constraint of {constraint}
maximum-constraint.description: This field value should be less or equal than constraint value.

minimum-length-constraint.name: Minimum Length Constraint
minimum-length-constraint.message: The value {cell} in row {rowNumber} and field {fieldName}[{fieldNumber}] does not conform to the minimum length constraint of {constraint}
minimum-length-constraint.description: A length of this field value should be greater or equal than schema constraint value.

maximum-length-constraint.name: Maximum Length Constraint
maximum-length-constraint.message: The value {cell} in row {rowNumber} and field {fieldName}[{fieldNumber}] does not conform to the maximum length constraint of {constraint}
maximum-length-constraint.description: A length of this field value should be less or equal than schema constraint value.

primary-key.name: Primary Key Error
primary-key.description: This row breakes the integrity of the table

foreign-key.name: Foreigh Key Error
foreign-key.description: This row breakes the integrity of the table
